author: glasser
msg: (This should be done on trunk anyway if this branch is rejected.)
Why "almost"?  Well, there's a C test that uses it, but that C test is
pretty wacky already (the mergeinfo it sets is invalid, it does a
svn_fs_get_mergeinfo on a non-existing path, etc).  And it doesn't
actually verify anything about the return value from
svn_fs_get_mergeinfo.  So ditch the test too.
Again, I only made changes to fs_base to keep it compiling; BDB is
still presumably broken on this branch.  (Though reverting the first
few revisions of this branch should fix that.)

author: glasser
msg: In FSFS, add a dummy implementation of svn_fs_get_mergeinfo_for_tree
that doesn't actually do anything recursive.  This ought to break log

author: glasser
msg: In FSFS, stop using libsvn_fs_util to implement svn_fs_get_mergeinfo.
Instead, just implement it ourself, using the information we have in
the noderevs about where mergeinfo is.
append_component_to_paths in mergeinfo-sqlite-index, except that we
use it just once instead of once per path component, and it does a
for a given path.  This is the function that implements
mergeinfo-sqlite-index, but instead of being recursive and
lengthening the merged-from-path one component at a time, just does
it all at once.  Also, doesn't need to look up svn:mergeinfo on
nodes that don't have it.  Also, doesn't maintain a cache; if we
have performance issues we can add it back later.
get_mergeinfo in mergeinfo-sqlite-index; calls the previous
using the previous helpers instead of libsvn_fs_util.

author: cmpilato
msg: Make the default merge source in the command-line client be the same
(svn_cl__merge): Default the merge source to the same thing as the target.
(svn_cl__cmd_table): Update usage information for merge subcommand.
(test_list): Remove reference to obnoxiously-lengthy function name,
